txt: The new yokozuna, Kakuryu, starts off with a shiroboshi victory.
Yokozuna Hakuho once again shows Endo his strength with an easy win.
Goeido wins over the undefeated Hakuho and earns himself a valuable star.
In a battle between those with one loss each, Hakuho is declared the winner.
Ikioi marks his 11th win and joins the battle for the championship. He receives the second Fighting Spirit Award of this tournament.
Kisenosato defends his two loss count, and is right behind Hakuho who has just one loss.
Harumafuji also keeps his loss count at two, and on the 14th day he will face Kisenosato in a battle to defend their two losses.
Hakuho defeats Kotoshogiku in a close battle, and defends his only loss. Harumafuji, Kisenosato, and Ikioi follow behind, each with two losses.
Ikioi, who had two losses so far, is defeated and drops out of the battle for the championship.
Hakuho wins over Kakuryu and defends his one loss count; if he wins tomorrow he will claim the championship. Depending on the Senshuraku, there may be a championship match.
Kisenosato is victorious in the battle between those with two losses each, and keeps his chances of winning the championship in the Senshuraku.

Sadanoumi, who just debuted into the Makuuchi Division, had a great score of 10 wins and 5 losses, and receives the Fighting Spirit Award. He leaves behind a new record of both father and son receiving a Sansho Award at their Makuuchi Debut tournament.
Goeido wins through the Senshuraku matches with a kachi-koshi, defends his position as a sekiwake, and receives his fourth Outstanding Performance Award.
Ozeki Kisenosato wins over the new yokozuna Kakuryu. If Hakuho is defeated, there will be a championship match.
Yokozuna Hakuho defeats Harumafuji, and claims the championship title. It has been two tournaments since he last won a championship, and this is now his 29th championship title.
